title: Cisco Multiple Routers Authorization Header Command Injection Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Cisco RV16x and RV26x routers. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the handling of file downloads. When parsing the Authorization  header, the process does not properly validate a user-supplied string before using it to execute a system call. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of root.
timeline:
2020-10-21 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2021-02-09 - Coordinated public release of advisory
